wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Norman Jackson VC (11 February 1897 – 27 September 1918) was an English soldier of the British Expeditionary Force, and posthumous recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest military award for gallantry in the face of the enemy given to British and Commonwealth forces, during the First World War.

response: *Thomas Norman Jackson (1897–1918), English soldier, Victoria Cross recipient
